        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

confusion<span class="line"><!---->Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Bug location<span class="line"><!---->### Bug location<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which product or website have you found a vulnerability in?<span class="line"><!---->#### Which product or website have you found a vulnerability in?<!----></span><br><br>Other - Chrome VRP<span class="line"><!---->Other - Chrome VRP<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which URL have you found the vulnerability in?<span class="line"><!---->#### Which URL have you found the vulnerability in?<!----></span><br><br>https://github.com/chromium/chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/chromium/chromium"><!---->https://github.com/chromium/chromium<!----></a><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### The problem<span         After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<span class="line"><!---->After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<!----></span><br><br>To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<span class="line"><!---->To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<!----></span><br><br>Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<span class="line"><!---->Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I just merged <span class="line"><!---->I just merged <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<span class="line"><!----> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of on<span class="line"><!---->I searched this dependency: **internal-scripts** on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>npmjs.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://npmjs.com"><!---->npmjs.com<!----></a> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed. I made package.json file with the name: internal-scripts and malicious file poc.js  by "npm init" command and published this package on my account.<span class="line"><!----> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed. I made package.json file with the name: internal-scripts and malicious file poc.js  by "npm init" command and published this package on my account.<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Go to this link: <span class="line"><!---->3. You will see this internal-scripts dependency claimed by me.<span class="line"><!---->4. You will see this internal-scripts dependency claimed by me.<!----></span><br>5. attacker able to Remotely execute his code on victim's machine.<span class="line"><!---->5. attacker able to Remotely execute his code on victim's machine.<!----></span><br><br>I uploaded following code in package.json file:<span class="line"><!---->I uploaded following code in package.json file:<!----></span><br><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>  "name": "internal-scripts",<span class="line"><!---->  "name": "internal-scripts",<!----></span><br>  "version": briefly explain who can exploit the vulnerability, and what they gain when doing so<!----></span><br><br>I(attacker) am able to remotly execute code on developers machine. when they use this project and use install dependencies from this project, my malicious(internal-scripts) dependency will install with all the dependecies and poc.js file will run code on victim's machine and will send the hostname, directory, ipaddress, username to attacker.<span class="line"><!---->I(attacker) am able to remotly execute code on developers machine. when they use this project and use install dependencies from this project, my malicious(internal-scripts) dependency will install with all the dependecies and poc.js file will run code on victim's machine and will send the hostname, directory, ipaddress, username to attacker.<!----></span><br><br>Note: **Please see video POC for better explaination**<span class="line"><!---->Note: **Please see video POC for better explaination**<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### The cause<span class="line"><!---->### The cause<!----></span><br><br><br>#### What version of Chrome crash?<!----></span><br><br>No<span class="line"><!---->No<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Choose the type of vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->#### Choose the type of vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Remote Code Execution (RCE)<span class="line"><!---->Remote Code Execution (RCE)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<span class="line"><!---->After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<!----></span><br><br>To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<span class="line"><!---->To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<!----></span><br><br>Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<span class="line"><!---->Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I just merged <span class="line"><!---->I just merged <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<span class="line"><!----> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi calamity@, as per <span class="line"><!---->Hi calamity@, as per <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1332593#c15<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1332593#c15"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1332593#c15<!----></a> the Lit repo no longer has any devDependencies on unregistered packages, so from our side this should be resolved. However, it sounds like Chrome is pulling in the Git repo directly, so can you verify that you are sync'd to a recent commit of the Lit repo that is after <span class="line"><!----> the Lit repo no longer has any devDependencies on unregistered packages, so from our side this should be resolved.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks.       ---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Report description<span class="line"><!---->### Report description<!----></span><br><br><br>Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<span class="line"><!---->Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Bug location<span vulnerability in?<!----></span><br><br>Other - Chrome VRP<span class="line"><!---->Other - Chrome VRP<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which URL have you found the vulnerability in?<span vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Hi,<span class="line"><!---->Hi,<!----></span><br><br>I found a [package.json](<span class="line"><!---->I found a class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> file, and unclaimed NPM dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of [package.json](<span class="line"><!----> file, and unclaimed NPM dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of on<span class="line"><!---->I searched this dependency: **internal-scripts** on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>npmjs.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://npmjs.com"><!---->npmjs.com<!----></a> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed. I made package.json file with the name: internal-scripts and malicious file poc.js  by "npm init" command and published this package on my account.<span class="line"><!----> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed. I made package.json file with the name: internal-scripts and malicious file poc.js  by "npm init" command and published this package on my account.<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Go to this link: <span class="line"><!---->3. You will see this internal-scripts dependency claimed by me.<span class="line"><!---->4. execute his code on victim's machine.<!----></span><br><br>I uploaded following code in package.json file:<span class="line"><!---->I uploaded following code in package.json briefly explain who can exploit the vulnerability, and what they gain when doing so<!----></span><br><br>I(attacker) am able to remotly execute code on developers machine. when they use this project and use install dependencies from this project, my malicious(internal-scripts) dependency will install with all the dependecies and poc.js file will run code on victim's machine and will send the hostname, directory, ipaddress, username to attacker.<span class="line"><!---->I(attacker) am able to remotly execute code on developers machine. when they use this project and use install dependencies from this project, my malicious(internal-scripts) dependency will install with all the dependecies and poc.js file will run code on victim's machine and will send the hostname, directory, ipaddress, username to attacker.<!----></span><br><br>Note: **Please see video POC for better explaination**<span class="line"><!---->Note: **Please see video POC for better explaination**<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### The cause<span class="line"><!---->### The cause<!----></span><br><br><br>#### What version of Chrome class="line"><!---->Chromium's latest version<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Is the security issue related to a crash?<span class="line"><!---->#### Is the security issue related to a crash?<!----></span><br><br>No<span class="line"><!---->No<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Choose the type of vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->#### Choose the type of vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Remote Code Execution (RCE)<span class="line"><!---->Remote Code Execution (RCE)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<span class="line"><!---->After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<!----></span><br><br>To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<span class="line"><!---->To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<!----></span><br><br>Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<span class="line"><!---->Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I just merged <span class="line"><!---->I just merged <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<span class="line"><!----> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi calamity@, as per <span class="line"><!---->Hi calamity@, as per <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1332593#c15<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1332593#c15"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1332593#c15<!----></a> the Lit repo no longer has any devDependencies on unregistered packages, so from our side this should be resolved. However, it sounds like Chrome is pulling in the Git repo directly, so can you verify that you are sync'd to a recent commit of the Lit repo that is after <span class="line"><!----> the Lit repo no longer has any devDependencies on unregistered packages, so from our side this should be resolved.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks.       ---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Report description<span class="line"><!---->### Report description<!----></span><br><br><br>Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<span class="line"><!---->Remote Code Execution(RCE) via Dependency confusion<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Bug location<span vulnerability in?<!----></span><br><br>Other - Chrome VRP<span class="line"><!---->Other - Chrome VRP<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which URL have you found the vulnerability in?<span vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Hi,<span class="line"><!---->Hi,<!----></span><br><br>I found a [package.json](<span class="line"><!---->I found a class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> file, and unclaimed NPM dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of [package.json](<span class="line"><!----> file, and unclaimed NPM dependency: **internal-scripts** in the dependencies section of href="https://npmjs.com"><!---->npmjs.com<!----></a> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed. I made package.json file with the name: internal-scripts and malicious file poc.js  by "npm init" command and published this package on my account.<span class="line"><!----> and it was giving me 404 error, dependency was unclaimed.         After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<span class="line"><!---->After some investigating, this doesn't run in the common flow of uprevving packages in the third_party/material_web_components directory.<!----></span><br><br>To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<span class="line"><!---->To get the internal-scripts package to install on my machine, I had to cd into node_modules/lit and run npm install there, whereas the update script reproduce.sh doesn't install dev dependencies for subpackages, and I don't see any reason any dev would cd into that folder and run npm install.<!----></span><br><br>Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<span class="line"><!---->Even so, this _is_ problematic and the lit team should remove it from their package.json, as demonstrated by the 90 weekly downloads the internal-scripts package has.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to aomarks@ who added this in <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/commit/0511d4061ab8cb95a78cfb292bc1c0c5f96f6e46<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I just merged <span class="line"><!---->I just merged <!----></span>https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024"><!---->https://github.com/lit/lit/pull/3024<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<span class="line"><!----> which renames Lit's `internal-scripts` package to `@lit-internal/scripts`, along with a number of other internal-only packages. `@lit-internal` is an npm namespace that we own, so packages within it cannot be registered by anybody else.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
